Pro-life centers have been vandalized in attempts to intimidate those who stand for life. I joined my colleagues in sending a letter urging the DOJ to investigate these attacks & provide info on how they will address these instances of domestic terrorism. 
https://t.co/Q7UH1gTQQp

UT’s agricultural sector has struggled for too long, and it’s past time for Congress to reduce input costs and provide relief to the farmers who feed our communities. I’m proud to cosponsor this bill, which will cut red tape, streamline regulations, and address inflation. #utpol

I am honored to be named a 2022 Fiscal Hero by @BudgetHawks. How we address our nation's economic crisis has been one of my top priorities during my first term. I will continue to seek solutions, both short and long term, for the sake of our next generation. #utpol

Learn more about my Debt and Deficit Task Force here:

https://t.co/jpDJyfI9Z6

I made a commitment to bring Utah’s fiscally sound values to Washington, and I am grateful to colleagues like @RepArrington for recognizing the work my team and I have done to address our economic crisis and convene a Debt and Deficit Task Force in Ogden. #utpol https://t.co/gBKtZZ8pZR

I joined @RepArrington for a Special Order on the House floor to speak about our current economic crisis, which is our nation's most pressing issue today. The Biden Admin's blatant economic mismanagement has put us on a path toward recession. #utpol 
https://t.co/6smZfA9soT

Grocery & gas prices continue to skyrocket, & Utahns are hurting. Due to inflation, the average household pays an additional $460/month for the same goods and services they purchased just last year. We must change course for the sake of the next generation's financial outlook.

Watch my floor speech from 16 months ago (February 2021) calling on the Biden Administration to approve domestic oil and gas leases here. #utpol 

https://t.co/hKQPvxE8vh

The national average for a gallon of gas is now over $5, and economists are projecting it will hit $6 by August. This crisis was avoidable, and I have been articulating the dangers of President Biden's anti-domestic energy agenda since my first weeks in office. #utpol (1/3)

Granting our pending oil and gas leases and unleashing US energy sources would have prevented these record high gas prices that are directly hurting every Utahn. We must bolster our domestic energy production so we can relieve this major cost burden on hardworking families.
I urge @NatResources to pass my bill requiring energy leases to be completed in 30 days. That is the first step to alleviate this record inflation. #utpol
We cannot go on like this. Hardworking families are suffering as inflation hits a 40-year high with no end in sight. The American people deserve better.
https://t.co/3gCV4zk0f9

Jane & I were deeply saddened to hear of Taylor Connors’s passing. A native of Pleasant View, he exemplified the best of UT at the UT Military Academy, as a Marine Corps Infantryman, & then as a Midshipman at the Naval Academy with selfless service, duty & honor. #utpol

It was great to meet with @ALPAPilots representatives, including two @Delta pilots from the First District, Jennifer Fiederer and Bart Wilbanks. We discussed reforms to our air travel systems that would better keep passengers and pilots safe. Thank you for your hard work! #utpol https://t.co/tuCBF47YFT
I am participating NOW in a radio telephone town hall with @KVNUftp to give an update from Washington and talk about the issues that matter most to Utahns. Tune in! #utpol

Congratulations to Greg Poulsen on his appointment to the Medicare Payment Advisory Commission! Greg is a valuable member of my Debt and Deficit Task Force, and I know he will bring his strong expertise and Utah’s values to the table. #utpol

https://t.co/IPIQxnmV5s
I’m grateful for all they are doing to keep our communities safe. #utpol

It was an honor to join @GovCox at the Utah Peace Officers Association awards banquet, where I delivered the keynote address. In a time of increased scrutiny and criticism, UPOA’s role has never been more important for the support of law enforcement officers. https://t.co/QHBzenXLmv

Due to drought, hundreds of acres of dry farmland will not produce wheat this year, leading to a decrease in healthy livestock. 

While there is no simple answer for the challenges we face, I am committed to finding productive, long-term solutions for our state’s drought issues.

Last week, I had the opportunity to visit Corinne, Park Valley, Snowville, and Howell on a tour of northern Box Elder County. At each stop, I met with local ranchers to discuss how the industry is impacted by current agricultural policies and water scarcity. #utpol https://t.co/rOLeGUKbFM
Thanks for hosting me, Intuitech! #utpol

Last week, I toured Intuitech with CEO Brock Emerson and learned about their pilot water treatment plants, how water treatment needs vary by city, the effects of pollution and droughts on water treatment efforts, and the impact supply chain disruptions are having on the company. https://t.co/m1pjtRPjY4

It was so special to send off veterans on their Honor Flight from the SLC airport this morning. They deserve every bit of recognition and celebration. Thank you for your service! #utpol https://t.co/WodSBGuEWy

This weekend was uniquely special because I connected w/ family members of Medal of Honor recipients George E Wahlen & Bernard Francis Fisher. These heroes left a lasting legacy, & I’m thrilled there will soon be a monument to honor them, their families, & the lives they saved. https://t.co/g9MIY1kGVS

Tomorrow I will greet veterans as they depart on an Honor Flight to celebrate their service to our nation. Utah appreciates and celebrates our veterans, and we are thankful to show our appreciation for their sacrifices. #utpol

My message this Memorial Day has been about gratitude. I was grateful to participate in events honoring veterans this weekend. My sons & I were fortunate in meeting a 98-year-old WW2 veteran in Ogden, & I got to share the stage w/ Vietnam POW Colonel Jay Hess in Kaysville. https://t.co/NLwt8JbZjg
I cleared my schedule to walk my boys to school this morning. As a dad, that was the best I could do today. I don’t yet know how to talk to them about what happened yesterday in Uvalde. (1/3) #utpol

Our nation is mourning and our communities are struggling. I want my constituents to know that I am someone who seeks unity, not division; avoids divisive rhetoric; and focuses on creating the type of world we want for our kids. (2/3) #utpol
Jane and I are heartbroken by this tragedy. Our hearts go out to each impacted family and pray they find peace. (3/3) #utpol
With all that's at stake, we cannot compromise our efforts towards energy independence or exacerbate the financial crisis of American families across the nation. #utpol
Last week, I joined 50 of my colleagues to urge the @USTreasury against implementing a windfall profits tax on American oil and gas producers.

Yesterday I visited @MatiaRobotics, a team of expert engineers dedicated to creating innovative robotic mobility products. They design technology that enhance the lives of individuals with walking disabilities so they have more housing options and mobility independence. https://t.co/idAXrHkbdH
Companies like Matia are changing people's lives, and it was a privilege to learn about their impactful work. #utpol

My visit to the Catalyst Center in Kaysville made me excited about the great educational opportunities my boys will have when they reach high school. The dynamic skills-based training they offer their students is exceptional and exactly what our education system needs. #utpol https://t.co/clipmZ6qEG
Today we recognize #ArmedForcesDay and the Americans who devote their lives to defending our freedom. We are grateful for your service! #utpol https://t.co/YX5Y7uqYt0

One of the biggest flops, or unforced errors, we've seen from the Biden Admin was to even propose this nonsensical "disinformation governance board" that even many Dems found ridiculous. I signed a letter to @DHSgov weeks ago raising ethical concerns.

https://t.co/a605sX3BmV
While I'm relieved to see it paused, it is still incredibly worrisome that a communist-style "Ministry of Truth" was even considered by this administration. #utpol

I introduced the Protecting American Energy Act, which will ensure domestic energy production can continue w/o political interference & hold the admin accountable as we seek to understand their unwillingness to work w/ domestic energy producers on solutions to our energy crises.

If the Biden Administration is so sure unleashing domestic energy production would not solve our skyrocketing gas prices and national security concerns, Americans deserve to know why. #utpol 

Read more about the Protecting American Energy Act here:
https://t.co/KhcHt8sk5P

Link to admendments here:

https://t.co/QHQ8Pnq6oA

Two of my amendments that would lower gas prices for Utahns and bolster domestic energy production were blocked by Democrats today. 

Our crippling energy prices are directly hurting Utahns, and we need action now. #utpol

Our debt crisis is one of the most pressing crises our nation faces. I was grateful to speak to @housebudgetGOP about my Debt & Deficit Task Force, which aims to create solutions to our economic challenges, including focusing America’s spending & fixing our budgeting process.

I was inspired by @WinsomeSears’s successful election for Virginia Lt. Gov, becoming the first Black woman elected to statewide office in VA. I enjoyed her remarks at our Whip Team meeting. She’s a strong voice for conservatism, and I look forward to watching her succeed. #utpol https://t.co/z1eCVHeh0Q

Last week we held a productive hearing, and I am pushing my Democrat colleagues to focus on provisions that will enhance our competitive advantage and strengthen American technology, manufacturing, and more. #utpol

I am honored to serve as the House Republican Conferee from @HASCRepublicans to the conference negotiating a bill between the House and Senate to bolster our competitiveness with China. #utpol https://t.co/dVUXf92LbT

The 1,200+ reservists in the 419th, men and women living and working in Utah but who remain committed to the mission, are indispensable to our nation’s armed services. Thank you for letting me join and be a part of your training weekend! #utpol

Yesterday, George and I got to welcome the 466th Fighter Squadron of the 419th Fighter Wing home from their training deployment, and I received a mission brief from the unit that just returned from Europe supporting the NATO mission. #utpol https://t.co/hm8V1hLsMA

The U.S. produces the cleanest energy in the world, so there is no reason to do this. We need to unleash our domestic energy supply now so we can relieve this major financial burden on hardworking Americans. #utpol

U.S. natural gas prices are the highest they’ve been in over 13 years, yet the Biden Administration continues to restrict domestic access to oil, failing to ease costs on American families. #utpol 

https://t.co/l3Y9RnZCJJ
https://t.co/ALi4opAEMa

I will continue to push for answers and help families in Utah and across the country get the resources they need. #utpol (3/3)

You can view my remarks on this issue here:
https://t.co/HrQQCsuHLp

My wife and I have a 6-month-old son, Franklin, who is dependent on formula. He was born a month early and had to undergo a rare and invasive surgery to separate his esophagus and trachea. A shortage is tough for us, but far worse for many Americans. #utpol (2/3)

This baby formula shortage we are currently facing is a major crisis for many American families with infants.

I signed a letter to the Biden Administration and FDA requesting information on this shortage and what they are doing to address this crisis. #utpol (1/3) https://t.co/EQj43tKucf

This morning I joined @GOPLeader for the Back the Blue Bike Tour to honor the sacrifices of our nation’s fallen law enforcement officers. During this #NationalPoliceWeek, & every day of the year, we recognize & thank the men and women who keep our communities safe. #BacktheBlue https://t.co/tGGlULzLDt

Congratulations to Aliahu K. Bey & @haightbey of West Haven for winning the Small Business Prime Contractor of the Year award! Small businesses play an essential role in Utah’s economy, and I appreciate the work SBA does to highlight entrepreneurs #utpol 
https://t.co/iGo9vJBAVs

153 years ago, the 1st transcontinental road was completed in Promontory Summit, Utah. We had a great time at the Golden Spike Family Days learning about the Golden Spike Ceremony & how this railroad’s completion marked a critical turning point in our nation’s history. #utpol https://t.co/EpQEvCVtma

I was so grateful Matt Gwynn invited me to be the keynote speaker for Friday’s @RoyCityPD Banquet. These men & women are amazing and dedicated public servants to their community, & I applaud them for their impactful work. It was a fun & casual evening with plenty of good banter. https://t.co/FkAHzoZgGK

For Winnie to thrive in traditional kindergarten took an extra dose of TLC, and Jane and I are so grateful to these teachers. Happy belated Teacher Appreciation Week to all of Utah’s amazing school teachers! #utpol

Last week was Teacher Appreciation Week, and along with meeting Utah’s Teacher of the Year, my boys’ teachers deserve recognition. In addition to Max’s amazing 3rd grade teacher Mrs. Leys, George and Winston’s kindergarten teachers Mr. Holt and Mrs. Lee are true heroes. #utpol https://t.co/ljchmR03kR

I always look forward to meeting w/ local chambers of commerce. I enjoyed talking to the @DavisChamberUT’s legislative affairs committee last week abt what my team is accomplishing for the 1st District & issues including supply chain disruptions, water supply, & inflation. #utpol https://t.co/jJv8RapDzJ
An extra special year for our family. Happy Mother’s Day to Jane and a sincere thanks for working double time for our boys!  #utpol https://t.co/8iE32vAvRy
I will always look up to Sen. Hatch and wish his family the best during this time. #utpol

It was an honor to attend the late Sen. Orrin Hatch’s funeral today. Hearing stories about his accomplished life and meeting his family made for a great afternoon. I especially loved hearing President Oaks’s comments about him being an effective legislator. #utpol

Read more about the Better Cybercrime Metrics Act here:

Yesterday @POTUS signed my Better Cybercrime Metrics Act into law! Cybercrime is one of the top threats facing Americans. It's imperative that we equip the gov to understand & address the challenges of cybercrime so we can improve our national cybersecurity infrastructure. #utpol

As we work to reshore our manufacturing, strengthen our supply chains, and prioritize national security, we are confronted by the immediate need to rebuild and bolster our entire microelectronics ecosystem. This bill will help us do just that. #utpol

Today I introduced the Supporting American Printed Circuit Boards Act with @RepAnnaEshoo in order to fuel the resurgence of American manufacturing through incentivizing the purchase and production of domestically-sourced printed circuit boards. #utpol 

https://t.co/2inDiWuIFY

I stopped by the @HAFB Fire Station this week to view the progress on the new west interchange and gate. Thanks for having me on, @kslnewsradio! #utpol 

https://t.co/7ltVS9Mc7A

Protecting life is among my greatest responsibilities in Congress. If a variation of this draft opinion ends up becoming SCOTUS’s final ruling, as I pray it does, it'll be a major step forward in restoring the authority of the people’s representatives to regulate abortion. #utpol

I was disheartened that Democrats in Congress voted for abortion on demand up until birth, and I believe our country can and must do far better for the most vulnerable members of our society. #utpol

https://t.co/PN7hZ3zJCQ

It doesn't get much better than touring the White House with @JStuartAdams as my MAPLand Act was signed into law on the other side of the building! 
Thank you to President Adams and grandson, Hunter, for sharing this special moment. #utpol https://t.co/BlHj2zGtEz

Today @POTUS signed the MAPLand Act into law! This is a major win for all who enjoy our public lands. I look forward to the many ways this bill will improve our access to public land records so we can better hunt, fish, hike, & more. #utpol

Thanks to all who helped get this across the finish line! Read more about the MAPLand Act here:

https://t.co/rTT8jbqmgw

The LODGE Act will do just that by providing the @natlparkservice w/ the tools to staff & manage these lands by improving access to housing & addressing recruiting & retention challenges, thus enhancing the overall experience for all who work in & enjoy our national parks. #utpol

Utah is known for our incredible national parks that attract millions of visitors each year. As visitation levels continue to skyrocket, we must pursue creative solutions to add efficiency to our system, lower costs, and serve the needs of our communities. #utpol

I just introduced the bipartisan LODGE Act w/ my friend @RepJimmyPanetta. This bill will foster innovative public-private partnerships to increase the availability of housing in and around our nation’s parks. #utpol 

https://t.co/kwdY7OhHUe

Some evenings in Congress are more special than others. It was an honor to attend the Washington DC Temple Open House hosted by @ChristoffDTodd. Thanks to my colleagues and their spouses for joining. https://t.co/KWYzYTVrDl
Thanks for having me on!

I visited TX today w/ @GOPLeader to learn more about the crisis at our southern border & the devastating impact it’s having on our communities’ safety. @POTUS’s decision to reverse Title 42 will exacerbate the overwhelming challenges our @CBP officers are already facing. #utpol

I joined UT’s elected representatives in voicing my objection over S&P Global’s issuing of political ESG ratings for UT. Rather than focusing on the fundamentals of UT’s financial strength, @SPGlobalRatings is allowing political judgments to cloud objective financial assessments.

I am looking forward to speaking as a panelist at the @MaloufFdn Summit today. I admire their work to raise awareness and education on human trafficking and sexual exploitation in Utah. #utpol https://t.co/afqyawCtGd

Congratulations to @thermofisher on their brand new manufacturing facility in Ogden! This facility will help produce COVID therapeutics and vaccines, bring 400 new jobs to the Ogden area, and serve as a great economic boost to Utah. #utpol https://t.co/amA8QTdnlB
I enjoyed attending the ribbon cutting ceremony and look forward to watching the @thermofisher team do great work here in the Beehive State. #utpol

Beginning next week, the political blackout begins and my office can only communicate with those who have opted-in to hear from us. We'll send you one e-newsletter per week with updates, announcements, and in-depth explanations on recent votes and legislation. #utpol

Fun fact: we have nearly 3x the number of newsletter subscribers than we do Twitter followers, proving that folks are looking for real, substantive updates. Be sure you are subscribed! #utpol

And suddenly, my four flights next week are much more bearable thanks to the brave judge who removed the mask mandate. It's past time. #utpol

And how can she brag that “no one has had to pay a penny of debt under Biden?” This administration’s approach to economic policy is a joke. (3/4)

We need real solutions to reverse the skyrocketing tuition costs that are negatively affecting students. Utah’s universities and tech colleges are leading the charge on this by tailoring curricula to workforce needs and focusing on ROI. (4/4)

Biden’s decisions have increased costs for working class families. What about the plumbers & electricians who stayed out of debt & worked their tails off to create careers w/o student loan debt? Do they get a check from Uncle Sam because they chose a different path? (2/4)
